channel.title: R/exams
channel.description: Automatic generation and evaluation of exams. From Markdown, LaTeX and R code to standalone documents, learning management systems and live voting.

item.title: ttest: Interpretation of 2-Sample t Test
item.description:
Name:
ttest
Type:
mchoice
Description:
Results of a 2-sample t.test() in R need to be interpreted regarding significance, type of alternative, and comparison of the underlying empirical means.
Solution feedback:
Yes
Randomization:
Random numbers, text blocks, and R output
Mathematical notation:
Yes
Verbatim R input/output:
Yes
Images:
No
Other supplements:
No
Template:
ttest.Rnw
ttest.Rmd
Raw: (1 random version)
ttest.tex
ttest.md
PDF:
HTML:

(Note that the HTML output contains mathematical equations in MathML. It is displayed by browsers with MathML support like Firefox or Safari - but not Chrome.)

Demo code:

library("exams")

set.seed(1090)
exams2html("ttest.Rnw")
set.seed(1090)
exams2pdf("ttest.Rnw")

set.seed(1090)
exams2html("ttest.Rmd")
set.seed(1090)
exams2pdf("ttest.Rmd")

item.title: tstat2: 1-Sample t-Test Statistic (Single-Choice)
item.description:
Name:
tstat2
Type:
schoice
Related:
tstat
Description:
Computing the 1-sample t-test statistic from randomly-drawn hypothesized mean, sample size, and empirical mean and variance. The correct answer has to be selected from five choice items which have been added to the numeric version of the exercise linked above.
Solution feedback:
Yes
Randomization:
Random numbers
Mathematical notation:
Yes
Verbatim R input/output:
No
Images:
No
Other supplements:
No
Template:
tstat2.Rnw
tstat2.Rmd
Raw: (1 random version)
tstat2.tex
tstat2.md
PDF:
HTML:

(Note that the HTML output contains mathematical equations in MathML. It is displayed by browsers with MathML support like Firefox or Safari - but not Chrome.)

Demo code:

library("exams")

set.seed(1090)
exams2html("tstat2.Rnw")
set.seed(1090)
exams2pdf("tstat2.Rnw")

set.seed(1090)
exams2html("tstat2.Rmd")
set.seed(1090)
exams2pdf("tstat2.Rmd")

item.title: switzerland: Knowledge Quiz Question about Switzerland
item.description:

switzerland

mchoice

item.title: swisscapital: Knowledge Quiz Question about the Swiss Capital
item.description:
Name:
swisscapital
Type:
schoice
Related:
switzerland

item.title: scatterplot: Interpretation of a Scatterplot
item.description:
Name:
scatterplot
Type:
mchoice
Description:
Scatterplot in an (x, y) regression setup needs to be interpreted regarding location/spread of the marginal distributions, the correlation in the joint distribution, and the corresponding regression slope. Data are drawn randomly from a suitable data-generating process so that each multiple-choice item is either about correct or clearly wrong.
Solution feedback:
Yes
Randomization:
Random numbers, text blocks, and graphics
Mathematical notation:
No
Verbatim R input/output:
No
Images:
Yes
Other supplements:
No
Template:
scatterplot.Rnw
scatterplot.Rmd
Raw: (1 random version)
scatterplot.tex
scatterplot.md
PDF:
HTML:

Demo code:

library("exams")

set.seed(1090)
exams2html("scatterplot.Rnw")
set.seed(1090)
exams2pdf("scatterplot.Rnw")

set.seed(1090)
exams2html("scatterplot.Rmd")
set.seed(1090)
exams2pdf("scatterplot.Rmd")

item.title: relfreq: Interpretation of Relative Frequency Tables
item.description:
Name:
relfreq
Type:
mchoice
Description:
A 4x2 table of relative frequencies needs to be interpreted by checking five multiple-choice items which all may either be true or false. Two tables are provided: the original absolute frequencies and one table of relative frequencies which randomly represents either total, or row, or column frequencies Each of the five items is also randomly selected from one of several possible variations.
Solution feedback:
Yes
Randomization:
Random numbers, text blocks, and R output
Mathematical notation:
No
Verbatim R input/output:
Yes
Images:
No
Other supplements:
No
Template:
relfreq.Rnw
relfreq.Rmd
Raw: (1 random version)
relfreq.tex
relfreq.md
PDF:
HTML:

Demo code:

library("exams")

set.seed(1090)
exams2html("relfreq.Rnw")
set.seed(1090)
exams2pdf("relfreq.Rnw")

set.seed(1090)
exams2html("relfreq.Rmd")
set.seed(1090)
exams2pdf("relfreq.Rmd")

item.title: regression: Simple Linear Regression (by Hand)
item.description:
Name:
regression
Type:
num
Description:
Computing coefficients and a point prediction from a simple linear prediction (by hand). Internally, a full bivariate data set is simulated but only the marginal means and variances and the correlation coefficient are presented in the exercise.
Solution feedback:
Yes
Randomization:
Random numbers
Mathematical notation:
Yes
Verbatim R input/output:
No
Images:
No
Other supplements:
No
Template:
regression.Rnw
regression.Rmd
Raw: (1 random version)
regression.tex
regression.md

HTML:

(Note that the HTML output contains mathematical equations in MathML. It is displayed by browsers with MathML support like Firefox or Safari - but not Chrome.)

set.seed(1090)

lm

item.title: lagrange: Method of Lagrange Multipliers
item.description:
Name:
lagrange
Type:
num
Description:
Computing the solution to a cost minimization problem subject to an output constraint where the production fuction with arguments capital and labor is of Cobb-Douglas type. As num exercises have only a single numeric solution (and to make test takers read the exercise carefully), one of three natural quantities in the optimum is selected randomly as the question: the first argument (capital), the second argument (labor), or the minimal function value (costs). The optimal solution is also displayed graphically using a contour plot.
Solution feedback:
Yes
Randomization:
Random numbers, text blocks, and graphics
Mathematical notation:
Yes
Verbatim R input/output:
No
Images:
Yes
Other supplements:
No
Template:
lagrange.Rnw
lagrange.Rmd
Raw: (1 random version)
lagrange.tex
lagrange.md
PDF:
HTML:

(Note that the HTML output contains mathematical equations in MathML. It is displayed by browsers with MathML support like Firefox or Safari - but not Chrome.)

Demo code:

library("exams")

set.seed(1090)
exams2html("lagrange.Rnw")
set.seed(1090)
exams2pdf("lagrange.Rnw")

set.seed(1090)
exams2html("lagrange.Rmd")
set.seed(1090)
exams2pdf("lagrange.Rmd")
